paragraph.paragraph:
Once you have
../30_database_selection/index.xml selected data from the database, it returns a set of rows containing queried columns values. Each row loaded with DB_SELECTION is stored in a DB_RESULT object. The easiest way to access the data is thus to refer to DB_RESULT objects themselves.
paragraph.note:
Note: Take a look at the
../50_data_object_coupling/index.xml Database/Eiffel objects Coupling to learn advanced data handling features.
paragraph.paragraph: To use DB_RESULT, process in 2 steps:
paragraph.heading: 2Retrieving DB_RESULT objects
paragraph.paragraph: /libraries/store/reference/interface/DB_SELECTION_flatshort.xmlDB_SELECTION class provides different ways to customize result loading:

list.item:
You want to access an unique row: /libraries/store/reference/interface/DB_RESULT_flatshort.xmlDB_RESULT object is accessible via cursor:
selection: DB_SELECTION my_result: DB_RESULT ... selection.query ("...") if selection.is_ok then selection.load_result my_result := selection.cursor end

You want to load a complete list of rows: /libraries/store/reference/interface/DB_SELECTION_flatshort.xmlDB_SELECTION can store /libraries/store/reference/interface/DB_RESULT_flatshort.xmlDB_RESULT objects in a list. To do this, you have mainly to provide a LIST object to DB_SELECTION with set_container:
selection: DB_SELECTION container: ARRAYED_LIST [DB_RESULT] create container.make (Max_results) ... selection.set_container (container) ... from container.start until container.after loop ... end
Tip: Provide /libraries/store/reference/interface/DB_SELECTION_flatshort.xmlDB_SELECTION with the LIST structure convenient for what you need to do with the results.

You want to select part of the result set: you can set an action in /libraries/store/reference/interface/DB_SELECTION_flatshort.xmlDB_SELECTION that will be executed each time a row is loaded. This action can for instance manipulate current row and define a stop condition.
You need to define a descendant of class ACTION and set it to /libraries/store/reference/interface/DB_SELECTION_flatshort.xmlDB_SELECTION:
class MY_ACTION inherit ACTION redefine execute, found end ... execute is do i := i + 1 end ... found: BOOLEAN is do Result := i >= Max_result end
Then set action to /libraries/store/reference/interface/DB_SELECTION_flatshort.xmlDB_SELECTION:
selection: DB_SELECTION action: MY_ACTION ... selection.set_action (action) selection.query ("...") if selection.is_ok then selection.load_result end

paragraph.heading: 2Accessing content of DB_RESULT
paragraph.paragraph:
A DB_RESULT object merely carries data retrieved from the database. You have to convert it to a DB_TUPLE to access data within the retrieved row conveniently, i.e. mostly the column values:
selection: DB_SELECTION tuple: DB_TUPLE ... create tuple tuple.copy (selection.cursor) if tuple.count >= 2 and then tuple.column_name (2).is_equal ("Firstname") then io.putstring (tuple.item (2).out) end
See Also
../30_database_selection/index.xml Performing a database selection.
